Dear Ms. Bastien:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
July 22, 2020. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule.
 Repeat violations require an explanation of why the previous corrective
action plan was unsuccessful.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 552-3662.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all of the following
information prior to employment or at the time specified in this
rule:
(c) Verification of high school diploma or GED when
specified by rule.
Two of eleven new hire employee files reviewed lacked verification of the
employee’s education as required.
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all of the following
information prior to employment or at the time specified in this
rule:
(e) Three dated references which are obtained prior to
employment from persons unrelated to the employee and which
are less than 12 months old.
One of eleven new hire employee files reviewed lacked three dated references as
required.
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all of the following
information prior to employment or at the time specified in this
rule:
(j) A written evaluation of the employee's performance within
30 days of the completion of the probationary period or within
180 days, whichever is less, and a written evaluation of the
employee’s performance annually thereafter.
Three of fourteen employee files reviewed lacked documentation of a written
evaluation as required. One of the three files an evaluation was completed, but late.
R 400.4114 Tuberculosis screening for employees and volunteers.
The licensee shall document, prior to employment, that each
employee and volunteer who has contact with residents 4 or
more hours per week for more than 2 consecutive weeks is free
from communicable tuberculosis. Freedom from communicable
tuberculosis shall be verified within the 1-year period before
employment and shall be verified every 1 year after the last
verification or prior to the expiration of the current verification.
4

Two of three employee files reviewed where the employee has been employed for
over a year did not verify the employee’s tuberculosis screening within 1 year after
the last verification, as required.
REPEAT VIOLATAION ESTABLISHED
Interim Inspection dated 8/9/19, CAP approval dated 9/3/19
R 400.4128 Initial staff orientation and ongoing staff training.
(3) The licensee shall document that each staff person whose
function is covered by these rules has participated in a minimum
of 50 clock hours of planned training within the first year of
employment and a minimum of 25 clock hours of training
annually thereafter related to the employee’s job function. At
least 16 of the 50 hours provided in the first year shall be
orientation provided prior to the assumption of duties.
Eleven of eleven new hire employee files reviewed lacked documentation of the
employee receiving 16 hours of orientation prior to assumption of duties as required.

(c) A brief description of the resident's preparation for

R 400.4153 Shelter care and detention institutions; preliminary service
plans.
Within 7 calendar days of admission, a plan shall be developed
for each resident. The plan shall include all of the following:
(a) The reason for care.
(b) An assessment of the resident’s immediate and specific
needs.
(c) The specific services to be provided by the institution.
(d) Other resources to meet the resident’s needs.
Two of two resident case files reviewed lacked preliminary service plans as required.
R 400.4166 Discharge plan.
(1) When a resident is discharged from institutional care, all of
the following information shall be documented in the case
record within 14 days after discharge:
(d) Any services that will be provided by the facility after
discharge.
Eight of eight closed resident files reviewed lacked documentation of the services
the facility will provide after discharge as required.
R 400.4515 Electrical Installations.
(1) In a newly constructed, converted, or remodeled facility,
the electrical wiring and equipment shall be installed in
accordance with the provisions of the national fire protection
association standard No. 70, entitled "National Electrical
Code," 2014. A final electrical certificate of approval for the
electrical installation shall be obtained from a qualified local
electrical inspecting authority or state electrical inspecting
authority.
(2) In an existing facility, electrical wiring and equipment
acceptable at the time these rules take effect shall continue to
be approved until the facility or portion thereof is remodeled or
converted. When an existing facility or portion thereof is
remodeled or converted, only that portion remodeled or
converted need comply with subrule (1) of this rule. Electrical
services shall be maintained in a safe condition. When
conditions indicate a need for inspection, the electrical
services shall be inspected by a licensed electrical inspection
service. A copy of the inspection report shall be maintained at
the facility for review. Any areas cited in the report shall be
6

corrected and a new electrical system inspection shall be
obtained verifying that corrections have been made.
All electrical switches, receptacles, etc. are not equipped with
the proper cover plate.
R 400.4538 Means of egress.
(1) Means of egress shall be considered the entire way and
method of passage to free and safe ground outside a
facility. All required means of egress shall be
maintained in an unobstructed, easily traveled condition
at all times.
(8) A means of egress shall not be used for the housing of
residents or storage of any kind and shall not be obstructed
or hidden from view by ornamentation, curtains, or other
appurtenances.
There is an accumulation of donated bedding that is being stored in the corridor,
entry way, etc. There are two freezers stored under the stairs in one stairway
adjacent to the kitchen.

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
 Discussed the facilities restraint policy and verified the facility does not use
restraint, but staff are trained in CPI and policy allows to physically restrain a
resident if they are at risk of harming themselves or others. Facility was provided
with CI 17-150 and are required to submit a letter requesting approval of
restraint model.
 The facility was provided with a link of the Child Caring Institution rules, PA 116
publication, along with the emergency order that went into effect on 7/16/20
regarding restraints.
7

 Reminded facility of timeframe for background checks including the need to run
central registry clearances on staff not more that 30 days prior to hire.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
 The facility has large documents which are hard to read or locate at times. It
was recommended the facility review the rules and ensure all rules are
covered and to simplify documentation if necessary.
 Facility notified consultant that Chief Administrator has changed roles. A new
Chief Administrator is needed. Reviewed the licensing rules regarding
qualifications and responsibilities with facility. They will provide consultant with
name, education verification and experience to review to start process of
change.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The facility has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period in response to their 2019 Interim Inspection.
A tour of the facility took place during the unannounced visit on July 22, 2020.
Residents rooms were observed to be clean with no noted safety concerns. The
window alarms were intact. The milieu and kitchen area were clean, and the meal
menu was posted. Cleaning supplies were locked and need a staff key to open.
Residents were observed waking up, playing basketball, eating breakfast, and
lounging in the milieu area.
During interviews with youth they reported they felt safe and had no concerns on how
staff treat them. They reported they are feed and provided with adequate space to
sleep. Youth interviewed provided a breakdown of the daily routine, services and
referrals provided by ARK staff. During interviews with staff they noted much change
within leadership of the organization of the course of the review period. Staff felt
supported and noted no concerns.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will
be issued a renewal of their regular license.
